programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Yeovil: The volatile reality series following rival auction experts who try to snare big prizes for low prices. A slice of Vegas is among the discoveries. Dan pushes Nat too far.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Picnics: The bikers explore our national love of picnics, celebrating classics such as the Cornish pasty and the Scotch egg, and baking a luxurious Dundee cake.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Times of Plenty: Time for the hairy ones to go gourmet, celebrating extravagant Britain with lobster, truffles, chocolate and the best cuts of meat on offer.

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve travels through Cornwall as the county emerges from the first Covid-19 lockdown and discovers the impact of the disease on its tourist industry.

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon's last leg begins on the remote Caribbean coast of Nicaragua before he encounters extreme violence on the mainland of Honduras and finishes his adventure on Jamaica.

programme.title: New: Special Ops: To Catch A Criminal
programme.desc: Operation Safeguard: A nationwide investigation begins when Dorset Police uncover an international gang posing as couriers to scam vulnerable pensioners out of thousands of pounds.

programme.title: New: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: Shark Invasion: The Wildcard heads to the Port of Karumba for its first unload payday of the season, and a confrontation with a hungry shark puts veteran Tom and rookie Pete on edge.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: QI

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons, Milton Jones, Hal Cruttenden, Holly Walsh and Ed Byrne look back at the previous seven days of stories, scoops and scandals and extract the hilarity.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain spins the Wheel of News once more as Gary Delaney, Rob Beckett, Romesh Ranganathan and Josh Widdicombe join Hugh and Andy to wittily dissect the week's headlines.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Body Swap: A classic episode of the enduring space comedy. Chaos ensues when the ship's circuitry is rewired by a Skutter, ending up with Lister loaning his body to Rimmer.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Timeslides: Smegging hilarious space sitcom. The crew discover a mutated developing fluid that allows them to travel to any place or time of which they have a photo. Cue mayhem.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Last Day: The sitcom set on a dysfunctional spaceship. Kryten discovers that his in-built expiry date gives him less than 24 hours to live, so the perfect send-off is called for.

programme.desc: Tension rises between Darren and Nancy, while a villager in search of the truth is sent in the wrong direction. Tommy's left with a chilling threat. And is a romance over before it's begun?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: DI Banks covers his tracks, but Donny's hot on his tail. Meanwhile, a marriage is on the rocks, a resident breaks the rules to try to make amends, and Tommy receives a worrying call...

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip featuring animals and food, from the always hilarious Tube that is Rude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Blackberry's: Gordon visits New Jersey to save floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's. Owner Shelley doesn't want to hear his advice, but then Gordon finds a dead mouse.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Sister, My Sitter: Lisa starts a new career as a babysitter. All is going well, until Marge and Homer employ her to look after Bart and Maggie...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer vs the Eighteenth Amendment: When alcohol is banned in Springfield, Moe's Tavern becomes a speakeasy and Homer reinvents himself as the Beer Baron.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Communication Deterioration: Raj is asked to create a message for NASA to use if one of their missions finds alien life. Penny considers taking up acting again.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Graduation Transmission: Leonard is invited to make a speech at his old high school. Howard and Sheldon can't make a toy drone fly.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Solar Calculator, a Game Ball, and a Cheerleader's Bosom: Sheldon struggles with his new-found popularity after he uses statistics to help the school football team.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Patch, a Modem, and a Zantac: Sheldon is determined to be proved right when a NASA official comes to school and dismisses one of his scientific suggestions.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: When Good Kids Go Bad: Mitch and Cam break the happy news that they're hoping to adopt another child. But then they realise Lily may not take well to another baby in the house.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil on Wire: Jay's relationship with the dog irritates Gloria. Phil and Luke try to master the tightrope. Cameron starts a juice fast.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Door to Door: Jay helps Manny with a school fundraiser. Claire campaigns for a stop sign at a busy junction. Phil and Luke try to create a viral video. Gloria searches for Stella.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Psychic Vortex: Sheldon and Raj go to a university party, where Raj lusts after a girl called Abby. Leonard regrets telling Penny he disapproves of her belief in psychics.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bozeman Reaction: After Leonard and Sheldon's flat is burgled, the gang create a new state-of-the-art security system to outwit any thieves and protect the place.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Einstein Approximation: Sheldon is baffled by a formula he's working on, so he gets a less mentally taxing job at the Cheesecake Factory to kick-start his creativity.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Dolomite, Apple Slices, and a Mystery Woman: Sheldon makes a new friend, while Mary and George disagree on how to handle Sheldon's blossoming social life.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Killer Asteroids, Oklahoma, and a Frizzy Hair Machine: A disappointing lack of success in a science fair competition sends Sheldon's life in a new direction.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Punkin Chunkin: When an old neighbourhood kid returns to town as a hugely successful internet billionaire, it gets Phil thinking of what could have been.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Express Christmas: The Pritchett clan decide to celebrate Christmas a little early so they split up to gather the holiday trappings as Mitchell, Alex and Lily hunt for a tree.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Wreck of the Relationship: Homer and Bart take part in a father-son therapy exercise on a ship. While they're away, Marge gets involved in Homer's fantasy football league.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Super Franchise Me: Marge opens a catering franchise after her sandwiches become a hit at the school. But then another franchise opens right across the street.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hot Troll Deviation: An embarrassing secret of Howard's comes to light as he tries to win back Bernadette. Sheldon and Raj have trouble working together.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Desperation Emanation: Leonard realises he's the only one of the gang with no girlfriend. Sheldon wants to get rid of his when she hatches a plan for him to meet her mother.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Irish Pub Formulation: A visit from Raj's sister Priya creates tension among the guys, especially when Leonard asks Sheldon to conceal his romantic past with her.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Star Is Born Again: A famous and sultry movie star (guest star Marisa Tomei) swoops into town with eyes for none other than Ned Flanders, making him the envy of Springfield.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The Blakes and the McQueens clash as they set up for Jez and John Paul's engagement party. Donny is guided towards the truth. And panic strikes when a resident is found unconscious.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Wedding for Disaster: Homer and Marge discover that they're not officially married when Reverend Lovejoy finds out he wasn't a licensed minister at the time of their ceremony.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: The final Commitment Ceremony, and after eight weeks in the experiment, it's the last time that our couples will meet with the experts. Part 1)

programme.title: New: The Honesty Box
programme.desc: Brand new series: Vicky Pattison and Lucinda Light host a radical new dating experiment as couples face a high-tech lie detector - with £100,000 at stake. The only rule? Do not lie! (Ep1/9)

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: The final Commitment Ceremony, and after eight weeks in the experiment, it's the last time that our couples will meet with the experts. Part 2)

programme.title: New: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Brand new series: Sam Prince and Miles reignite their feud. Sam Vanderpump and Alice celebrate their engagement with everyone... except Reza. And Livvy and Freddy come to blows.

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: (1983) Al Pacino stars in Brian De Palma's classic crime thriller. A Cuban immigrant uses the coaine trade to take what he wants of the American dream. Say hello to my little friend.

programme.title: Amores Perros
programme.desc: (2000) Gritty acclaimed thriller from Alejandro Iñárritu following three individuals' lives, momentarily united in the aftermath of a car accident. In Spanish/subs.

programme.desc: (1957) David Lean's Oscar-winning fact-based Second World War classic stars Alec Guinness as the driven commander of a group of POWs building a rail bridge for the Japanese.

programme.title: The Kid Who Would Be King
programme.desc: (2019) Fantasy adventure. A 12-year-old from modern-day suburbia finds King Arthur's sword Excalibur and must save the country from a sinister sorceress. With Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: (2001) Scary sci-fi comedy. Can David Duchovny, Julianne Moore and Orlando Jones save humanity from a rapidly evolving, predatory alien species? Well, DD used to be Fox Mulder, so...

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: (2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.

programme.title: Free Guy
programme.desc: (2021) Comedy action starring Ryan Reynolds. Guy lives in Free City. Free City isn't real. Nor is Guy. It's all a big online game. Can he take down the corrupt game publisher?

programme.title: Benedetta
programme.desc: (2021) Paul Verhoeven's historical drama. Sex and the sacred collide as a Renaissance nun begins to have visions of Christ, while also taking a shine to one of her sisters. In French/subs.

programme.title: Bitch Ass
programme.desc: (2022) Slasher horror. It's 1999 LA, and a bunch of kids get sent to rip off a house in their hood. Unfortunately, it belongs to a masked serial killer who likes to play games... literally.

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes:...
programme.desc: ...Talking Film: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections.

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: (2009) Martial arts adventure. Justin Chatwin stars as the leader of a mystical band of warriors who are out to save the world from the ancient demon Lord Piccolo. With James Marsters.

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
programme.desc: (1997) Romcom with Julia Roberts and Cameron Diaz. Is it okay for a girl to wreck a wedding because she only realises she loves a guy when he tells her he's getting married to someone else?

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Honest Thief
programme.desc: (2020) Action thriller starring Liam Neeson as a notorious bank robber. He wants to give it all up for love but is cheated by corrupt FBI agents. Can he clear his name and get the girl?

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: (2009) Part four of the sci-fi franchise. The machines have massacred mankind in their bid to rule the planet. But resistance leader John Connor (Christian Bale) has a plan...

programme.title: Monos
programme.desc: (2019) Alejandro Landes's hallucinatory war film. A ragtag band of teenage soldiers, who live on a mountaintop in Latin America, guard an American hostage with their lives. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as 2023 King of the Jungle Sam Thompson tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous banker for the chance to win a cash prize for charity. Sam is supported in the wings by friends, family and a few famous faces, including former I'm a Celebrity campmates

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: The writer and activist invites celebrity guests into her one-stop shop for wellness needs, fitness, food and entertainment. Actress Natalie Cassidy joins Katie for some goat yoga and hairdresser Michael Douglas transforms a charity founder

programme.title: A Year in the Beacons
programme.desc: It's winter in the Brecon Beacons and fifth-generation farmer Andrew Phillips welcomes his first lambs to the flock. Glanusk Estate owner Harry Legge-Bourke deals with serious flooding, and the mountain rescue team goes to the rescue of two snowboarders on Pen-y-fan, South Wales' highest peak

programme.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Fantasy based on the classic children's book by Roald Dahl, starring Gene Wilder. Most children, at one hungry time or another, dream of visiting a chocolate factory. For young Charlie Bucket the fantasy comes true when he finds a golden ticket in a candy bar: an invitation to tour the giant factory of eccentric sweet tycoon Willy Wonka.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Comedian Joe Pasquale joins Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar in the kitchen as Shivi prepares a one-pan breakfast hash with all the trimmings. Jimmy stops by to see the armadillos at the wildlife park and the group get their hands dirty in a clay workshop

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Judy Joo provide the food and Merlin Griffiths serves up the cocktails

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Comedian Ruby Wax joins Prue in the kitchen to cook a warm salad with beef - and a version with tofu. Prue also makes clafoutis with plums and apricots. John solves the problem of having too many apples by taking them off to be pressed into juice, and a local whiskey distillery produces some of the whiskey that Prue uses to make a traditional Scottish cranachan with the help of John

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef heads to Castle of Mey in Caithness, once home to Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother and now a treasured place to King Charles. Head gardener Chris tells Raymond about the history of the walled garden and reveals how they grow produce in such a challenging location, while chef Martin cooks an Aberdeen Angus fillet steak with seasonal vegetables from the gardens

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the finale to the National Hunt season from Sandown Park, including the Celebration Chase and bet365 Gold Cup. Plus, flat racing from Haydock Park and Leicester. Analysis comes from AP McCoy and Mick Fitzgerald, with reporting by Oli Bell and Megan Nicholls, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: The remaining 26 players must find a dummy in jelly while blindfolded, untangle themselves from a length of rope and defrost a whistle from a block of ice to avoid elimination

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as the first eight acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance at a place in the final. For the first time in the history of the show, the golden buzzer now appears in the live rounds, giving judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, the power to send one act straight through to the grand final. The audience will then vote for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Charlene White, Shazia Mirza, Jessica Fostekew and Stephen K Amos join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to take viewers on a tour of Black British history.

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Hull City v Derby County at MKM Stadium, Queens Park Rangers v Burnley at MATRADE Loftus Road Stadium and Oxford United v Sunderland at Kassam Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Final time! Three remaining contestants must create dishes on all three levels in 90 minutes - an appetiser, a seafood dish, and a meat-focused dish. Who will be crowned winner?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more foundlings track down the people who gave them up as babies. Thomas was left in the waiting room of Reading train station in 1965 and the first birth relative the team finds for him is another foundling, left on the steps of a Dublin church. Apart from DNA, all they share at first are questions, but their meeting soon leads to life-changing discoveries for them both

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef heads to Castle of Mey in Caithness, once home to Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother and now a treasured place to King Charles. Head gardener Chris tells Raymond about the history of the walled garden and reveals how they grow produce in such a challenging location, while chef Martin cooks an Aberdeen Angus fillet steak with seasonal vegetables from the gardens

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Judy Joo provide the food and Merlin Griffiths serves up the cocktails

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Coronation Street star Claire Sweeney joins Katie to try hobby horse exercise. Celebrity hairdresser Michael Douglas and makeup artist Genevieve Turley transform founder of cancer support charity Help Harry Help Others, Georgie Moley. Chef Jonny Marsh prepares some treats for everyone

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: Animated comedy musical featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Scarlett Johansson and Reese Witherspoon. Buster Moon, the koala owner of a failing theatre, decides to hold a talent show to save it. However, a printing error adds two zeroes to the $1,000 prize, resulting in a stampede of contestants - and a big headache for Buster.

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Nottingham Forest v Manchester City (Kick-off 4.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Forest are looking to lift the trophy for the first time since 1959 and they have got this far the hard way, winning on penalties in each of the last three rounds against Exeter City, Ipswich Town and Brighton & Hove Albion. City last won the cup as recently as two seasons ago and were runners-up to Manchester United last term. This time around the competition represents their last chance to win silverware this season and they came back from behind to beat Bournemouth 2-1 away in the quarter-finals. With analysis from Roy Keane, Joleon Lescott and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon, and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a charity edition of the game show, with Mark Charnock, Kerry Godliman and Janet Street-Porter all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: The team emerges from the ashes of a shocking betrayal and prepares for a major criminal trial - after Grace's team intercepted millions of pounds of cocaine being smuggled into Newhaven port in a case involving an elusive figure known as The Merchant, Roy is determined to see him go down for his crimes as the ruthless drug lord faces trial. Brighton resident Meg Magellan's daughter Laura leaves for a gap year as Meg receives a jury summons that poses a dilemma

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: David Tennant takes part in the innovative interview show in which he is questioned by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent and/or learning disabled. Does he believe in God? How did it feel to lose his parents? Does he know how to vogue? From his skincare regime to his cancelled friend, no subject is out of bounds

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Action comedy sequel starring Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L Jackson and Salma Hayek. Hired heavy Michael Bryce is approached by Sonia Kincaid to find and rescue her husband - Bryce's former protectee - who has been kidnapped by mobsters. What starts as an easy job quickly spirals into trouble when the reunited trio is recruited for a much bigger mission.

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Wine Tour: South Africa
programme.desc: Gary is joined by Ben Shephard as he travels up into the mountains to Iona Wines where they pick grapes, have a lesson on wine aging and are treated to some home cooking. The pair then meet one of the country's youngest wine producers, Maanschijn, in Walker Bay where they get stuck in with some traditional wine making methods before sampling the best the winery has to offer and taking a trip down the Klein River

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

John solves the problem of having too many apples by taking them off to be pressed into juice, and a local whiskey distillery produces some of the whiskey that Prue uses to make a traditional Scottish cranachan with the help of John

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the beauty of the cherry blossom and Japanese maple as he takes seasonal inspiration from his own garden. Claire Lowrie gives advice on saving tired houseplants and Camilla Basset-Smith explores an arts and crafts garden. Henry Agg demonstrates how to build a DIY plant support and Errol Reuben Fernandes joins a community green space in the Midlands to help bring their wildlife-friendly bog garden to life

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a quiz based on the long-running American version, with players presented with clues in the form of answers and having to phrase their responses in the form of a question. Three contestants hope their razor-sharp intellect and speed on the buzzer will be enough to be crowned today's champion

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Danny from Sheffield, Karen from Oxfordshire, Carly from Cumbria and Richard from Ware pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John panics, while Chas and Liam are disheartened and Sarah makes a big decision

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Debbie's worst fears are confirmed by a diagnosis, Daniel catches Christina with two phones, and Carl makes a move on Abi. Meanwhile, Lauren confides her troubles to Bobby, and Carla suspects Betsy of manipulating Lisa

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. In 2019, the airport is having its busiest year to date, and are expecting more than 81 million passengers to fly in and out of the terminals, with its 76,000 staff ready to take on whatever is thrown at them

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as the first eight acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance at a place in the final. For the first time in the history of the show, the golden buzzer now appears in the live rounds, giving judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, the power to send one act straight through to the grand final. The audience will then vote for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. First to face the grilling of a lifetime, actor Danny Dyer. Why did he go to therapy? How does it feel to be a sex symbol for mums? From class and kebabs to absent fathers and Brexit, no subject is out of bounds as Britain's favourite foul-mouthed TV personality comes face to face with The Assembly

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sorry, I Didn't Know
programme.desc: Charlene White, Shazia Mirza, Jessica Fostekew and Stephen K Amos join team leaders Chizzy Akudolu and Eddie Kadi to take viewers on a tour of Black British history.

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Hull City v Derby County at MKM Stadium, Queens Park Rangers v Burnley at MATRADE Loftus Road Stadium and Oxford United v Sunderland at Kassam Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Final time! Three remaining contestants must create dishes on all three levels in 90 minutes - an appetiser, a seafood dish, and a meat-focused dish. Who will be crowned winner?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more foundlings track down the people who gave them up as babies. Thomas was left in the waiting room of Reading train station in 1965 and the first birth relative the team finds for him is another foundling, left on the steps of a Dublin church. Apart from DNA, all they share at first are questions, but their meeting soon leads to life-changing discoveries for them both

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef heads to Castle of Mey in Caithness, once home to Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother and now a treasured place to King Charles. Head gardener Chris tells Raymond about the history of the walled garden and reveals how they grow produce in such a challenging location, while chef Martin cooks an Aberdeen Angus fillet steak with seasonal vegetables from the gardens

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Judy Joo provide the food and Merlin Griffiths serves up the cocktails

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Coronation Street star Claire Sweeney joins Katie to try hobby horse exercise. Celebrity hairdresser Michael Douglas and makeup artist Genevieve Turley transform founder of cancer support charity Help Harry Help Others, Georgie Moley. Chef Jonny Marsh prepares some treats for everyone

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: Animated comedy musical featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Scarlett Johansson and Reese Witherspoon. Buster Moon, the koala owner of a failing theatre, decides to hold a talent show to save it. However, a printing error adds two zeroes to the $1,000 prize, resulting in a stampede of contestants - and a big headache for Buster.

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Nottingham Forest v Manchester City (Kick-off 4.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Forest are looking to lift the trophy for the first time since 1959 and they have got this far the hard way, winning on penalties in each of the last three rounds against Exeter City, Ipswich Town and Brighton & Hove Albion. City last won the cup as recently as two seasons ago and were runners-up to Manchester United last term. This time around the competition represents their last chance to win silverware this season and they came back from behind to beat Bournemouth 2-1 away in the quarter-finals. With analysis from Roy Keane, Joleon Lescott and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon, and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a charity edition of the game show, with Mark Charnock, Kerry Godliman and Janet Street-Porter all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: The team emerges from the ashes of a shocking betrayal and prepares for a major criminal trial - after Grace's team intercepted millions of pounds of cocaine being smuggled into Newhaven port in a case involving an elusive figure known as The Merchant, Roy is determined to see him go down for his crimes as the ruthless drug lord faces trial. Brighton resident Meg Magellan's daughter Laura leaves for a gap year as Meg receives a jury summons that poses a dilemma

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: David Tennant takes part in the innovative interview show in which he is questioned by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent and/or learning disabled. Does he believe in God? How did it feel to lose his parents? Does he know how to vogue? From his skincare regime to his cancelled friend, no subject is out of bounds

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Action comedy sequel starring Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L Jackson and Salma Hayek. Hired heavy Michael Bryce is approached by Sonia Kincaid to find and rescue her husband - Bryce's former protectee - who has been kidnapped by mobsters. What starts as an easy job quickly spirals into trouble when the reunited trio is recruited for a much bigger mission.

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Wine Tour: South Africa
programme.desc: Gary is joined by Ben Shephard as he travels up into the mountains to Iona Wines where they pick grapes, have a lesson on wine aging and are treated to some home cooking. The pair then meet one of the country's youngest wine producers, Maanschijn, in Walker Bay where they get stuck in with some traditional wine making methods before sampling the best the winery has to offer and taking a trip down the Klein River

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Comedian Ruby Wax joins Prue in the kitchen to cook a warm salad with beef - and a version with tofu. Prue also makes clafoutis with plums and apricots. John solves the problem of having too many apples by taking them off to be pressed into juice, and a local whiskey distillery produces some of the whiskey that Prue uses to make a traditional Scottish cranachan with the help of John

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the beauty of the cherry blossom and Japanese maple as he takes seasonal inspiration from his own garden. Claire Lowrie gives advice on saving tired houseplants and Camilla Basset-Smith explores an arts and crafts garden. Henry Agg demonstrates how to build a DIY plant support and Errol Reuben Fernandes joins a community green space in the Midlands to help bring their wildlife-friendly bog garden to life

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a quiz based on the long-running American version, with players presented with clues in the form of answers and having to phrase their responses in the form of a question. Three contestants hope their razor-sharp intellect and speed on the buzzer will be enough to be crowned today's champion

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Danny from Sheffield, Karen from Oxfordshire, Carly from Cumbria and Richard from Ware pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: John panics, while Chas and Liam are disheartened and Sarah makes a big decision

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Debbie's worst fears are confirmed by a diagnosis, Daniel catches Christina with two phones, and Carl makes a move on Abi. Meanwhile, Lauren confides her troubles to Bobby, and Carla suspects Betsy of manipulating Lisa

programme.title: The Essex Millionaire Murders
programme.desc: A look at the investigation into the murders of Carol and Stephen Baxter, a wealthy couple in their 60s who were found dead by their daughter on Mersea Island in Essex on Easter Sunday in 2023. With no sign of struggle and carbon monoxide poisoning ruled out, a mysterious will that leaves everything to their daughter and a family friend points police in a new direction

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. In 2019, the airport is having its busiest year to date, and are expecting more than 81 million passengers to fly in and out of the terminals, with its 76,000 staff ready to take on whatever is thrown at them

programme.desc: Comedian Joe Pasquale joins Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar in the kitchen as Shivi prepares a one-pan breakfast hash with all the trimmings. Jimmy stops by to see the armadillos at the wildlife park and the group get their hands dirty in a clay workshop

programme.title: ITV News

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury joins James at his home in the Hampshire countryside, where Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Judy Joo provide the food and Merlin Griffiths serves up the cocktails

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Comedian Ruby Wax joins Prue in the kitchen to cook a warm salad with beef - and a version with tofu. Prue also makes clafoutis with plums and apricots. John solves the problem of having too many apples by taking them off to be pressed into juice, and a local whiskey distillery produces some of the whiskey that Prue uses to make a traditional Scottish cranachan with the help of John

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: The chef heads to Castle of Mey in Caithness, once home to Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother and now a treasured place to King Charles. Head gardener Chris tells Raymond about the history of the walled garden and reveals how they grow produce in such a challenging location, while chef Martin cooks an Aberdeen Angus fillet steak with seasonal vegetables from the gardens

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the finale to the National Hunt season from Sandown Park, including the Celebration Chase and bet365 Gold Cup. Plus, flat racing from Haydock Park and Leicester. Analysis comes from AP McCoy and Mick Fitzgerald, with reporting by Oli Bell and Megan Nicholls, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: The remaining 26 players must find a dummy in jelly while blindfolded, untangle themselves from a length of rope and defrost a whistle from a block of ice to avoid elimination

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent: Live Semi-Final
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as the first eight acts that made it through the audition rounds perform in front of the judges and a live audience for a chance at a place in the final. For the first time in the history of the show, the golden buzzer now appears in the live rounds, giving judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli, as well as presenters Ant and Dec, the power to send one act straight through to the grand final. The audience will then vote for their favourite act, who will gain the second place

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Innovative interview show in which celebrities are quizzed by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent or learning disabled. programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more foundlings track down the people who gave them up as babies. Thomas was left in the waiting room of Reading train station in 1965 and the first birth relative the team finds for him is another foundling, left on the steps of a Dublin church. Apart from DNA, all they share at first are questions, but their meeting soon leads to life-changing discoveries for them both

Buster Moon, the koala owner of a failing theatre, decides to hold a talent show to save it. However, a printing error adds two zeroes to the $1,000 prize, resulting in a stampede of contestants - and a big headache for Buster.

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: Comedy starring John Candy and Macaulay Culkin. Buck Russell is a fun-loving bachelor without a care in the world. He's also the world's greatest slob. So when he has to look after his sharp young nephew and nieces while their parents are away, anything can - and will - happen.

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Nottingham Forest v Manchester City (Kick-off 4.30pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Forest are looking to lift the trophy for the first time since 1959 and they have got this far the hard way, winning on penalties in each of the last three rounds against Exeter City, Ipswich Town and Brighton & Hove Albion. City last won the cup as recently as two seasons ago and were runners-up to Manchester United last term. This time around the competition represents their last chance to win silverware this season and they came back from behind to beat Bournemouth 2-1 away in the quarter-finals. With analysis from Roy Keane, Joleon Lescott and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon, and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a charity edition of the game show, with Mark Charnock, Kerry Godliman and Janet Street-Porter all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Grace
programme.desc: The team emerges from the ashes of a shocking betrayal and prepares for a major criminal trial - after Grace's team intercepted millions of pounds of cocaine being smuggled into Newhaven port in a case involving an elusive figure known as The Merchant, Roy is determined to see him go down for his crimes as the ruthless drug lord faces trial. Brighton resident Meg Magellan's daughter Laura leaves for a gap year as Meg receives a jury summons that poses a dilemma

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: David Tennant takes part in the innovative interview show in which he is questioned by an audience of inquisitive individuals who are autistic, neurodivergent and/or learning disabled.
